question: Who has been named the winner of the 1 million-Euro ‘Gulbenkian Prize for Humanity’?
explanation:
The 17-year-old Climate activist Greta Thunberg has been named the winner of Portuguese rights award ‘Gulbenkian Prize for Humanity’.
She has also won prestigious awards including Amnesty International's top human rights prize and the Swedish Right Livelihood Award. As a response to this award, Greta announced that all the prize money would be donated to groups working to protect the environment and stop climate change.
